尊.definition: senior; of a senior generation; to honor; to respect; honorific; classifier for cannons and statues; ancient wine vessel

尊尚.definition: to value highly; to hold up sth as a model

尊崇.definition: to revere; to admire; to honor; to venerate

尊師愛徒.definition: title of a Daoist priest; revered master

尊師貴道.definition: to revere the master and his teaching

尊從.definition: to obey; to observe; to follow

尊意.definition: (honorific) your respected opinion; What do you think, your majesty?

尊敬.definition: to respect; to revere; to esteem; honorable; distinguished (used on formal occasions before a term of address)

尊稱.definition: to address sb deferentially; title; honorific

尊老愛幼.definition: respect the old and cherish the young

尊者.definition: honored sir (a person of higher status or seniority, or a Buddhist monk)

尊號.definition: honorific title; form of address reserved for a queen, ancestor, emperor etc

尊賢使能.definition: to respect talent and make use of ability (Mencius)

尊賢愛物.definition: to honor the wise and love the people; respecting noble talent while protecting the common people

尊重.definition: to esteem; to respect; to honor; to value; eminent; serious; proper

尊長.definition: one's superior; one's elders and betters

尊駕.definition: lit. your honored carriage; your highness; honored Sir (also sarcastic); you
